Backdrop of the 80's For the longest time I've thought of Metallica as a mainstream heavy metal 
band that was mainly a phenomenon of the 90's because their Black Album is 
what is always played on the radio. I was aware they had a back catalogue 
reaching into the 80's, but I had no idea they had such a seminal influence 
on heavy metal in that period. Probably much of the heavy metal I heard 
others listen to in the 80's was from this album - I just never realized, 
until now!

Metallica at its best In my opinion their best album by far. Master of Puppets is the album that 
helped change Speed/Thrash Metal and made Metallica one of the big four 
along with Megadeath, Anthrax and Slayer. Master of Puppets, Battery and 
Disposable Heros are fan favourites and all over tracks keep the album nice 
and ballanced. This album is on top of their top 3 along with The Black 
Album and Death Magnetic, respectivly

Masters of puppets An absolute classic must have I think there best album ever but

Pink Floyd - dark side of the moon A wonderful enlightenment to the mellow side of music. Kick back relax 
turn up your stereo. Enjoy this work off art. Play once & you will like.

Zeppelin - going to California . You will need to purchase this too.

Sweet! Their best by far! wow! This is crazy, especially since I've been looking at Pink Floyd's 
music trying to decide who had the better price. Ha! You guys made that 
choice and this is the album I wanted. Every album and CD of theirs I've 
owned has sprouted legs and disappeared. This one will be mind forever!

To the obvious minimal "Anything below 5 *'s" You must be a child. Therefore since the actual music and actual art 
sounds so good that it scares the diapers off of you then yeah I 
understand. But learn something about art in its true form. The best of the 
best is here. Its Pink Floyd ...I need not say more. I'm a musician. 30 out 
of my 41 years of age. Though I listen to much more subtle than my younger 
age I never since my mom played the wall when I was 4 and first heard it I 
sang it everywhere. School is out. Peace! From your teacher:-)

A modern classic I don't know of any other album that has stood up to the test of time (see 
what I did there?) more than The Dark Side of the Moon. Though it was 
released in 1973, it was still relevant in the 90's, when I was a teenager, 
and still is today. Very few artists can match the level of musicianship 
that went into crafting these songs. I for see this album still being 
played hundreds of years from now. And if the band you're in starts playing 
different tunes, I'll see you on the dark side of the moon.

Great, but Pink Floyd's Best? For the longest time, this was in my favorite Pink Floyd album, and in my 
top 10. I've found an album by them I prefer, and this one isn't in my top 
10 anymore, but it is still a great album for sure. The instrumentals don't 
do much outside the album, but songs like Breathe, Time, Money and Us And 
Them are among the Floyd's best. Iv'e always found Great Gig and Brain 
Damage overrated, but the album still deserves to be called one of the best 
of all time.

Good Old Days Back in 73, when I graduated high school, this album had just come out. 
The student addressing the crowd used lyrics from some of these songs at 
commencement. "10 years have gone by, I missed the starting gun",,, stuff 
like that. I didnt have any nice stereo equipment back then so I never 
really heard this Album like Im hearing it today,, AWESOME !

THE FIRST TIME IN a few days. I have time to Listen to Some Great Music and 
Relax A little bit of time? Some things you should have to Listen to it The wall and Dark side of the 
moon! Are some really good Tune's! includes my Opinion! :-) Thank you!

Good stuff Their first huge hit album. I prefer the whimsy of wish you were here 
but..how can 50 million listeners be wrong..dark sides back k catalogue 
I.e. releases previous to the moon are like obscure demos meets elaborate

The Dark Side Of The Moon Pink Floyd will always Be Relaxing & True To Your Soul music.Whenever, I

Well tasty I listened to this on Telly and loved/liked it. Well good .. wont buy the

Amazing Album this album is meant to be listened all the way through in one sitting.

Dark side of the moon Great electronic and synthesizers sounds. Back in the 1970s, Pink Floyd 
was a rock band with progressive sounds and great lyrics. Money, time, 
shine on you... are great songs and good examples of what I'm talking 
about. I will never get tired of listening Pink's dark side album songs.

All time favourite album I'm a huge metal head but Pink Floyd is my all time favourite band and 
this my my favourite album. I get chills throughout the album. David 
Gilmour's guitar work is unmatched. You can tell that the whole band had a 
creative opinion during creation of it and not controlled by Rogers.

To Those Who Put One Star You're entitled to your own opinion and I respect your opinion, but I 
still hope you die a very long and painful death. Like swimming through a 
pool of tabasco sauce and razor blades. Or dying of lack of oxygen in The 
Dark Side Of The Moon, or any side of the moon.

WOW!! OMG only .99¢ today I can't believe I got one of the great albums of all time for $0.99 today 
I had actually forgot about this album until I saw it advertised in the 
other day instantly brought back great memories and I need the music was 
good without even listening to it again. Now I'm listening to it in a way I 
never was able to back in the 70's as a teenager

Number 1 If we were to represent humanity as a whole with a single album, this 
would be the album. Was on the charts for 15 years straight, fell off and 
came right back on. Musical perfection.

A flawless recording! Not only incredibly textured in its production but don't forget, this was 
done before the digitalization of keyboards, so all the layers are looped 
basically manually. Check out the documentary on the recording with 
comments by the band members. Pink Floyd stand alone!

THE GREAT PINK FLOYD I tripped to it many times, including their concert,Wheeling, WV. Syd 
Barrett,1st of the founding members, 1st guitarist for Pink Floyd and also 
is the father of the light shows, crazy guitar and keyboard sounds that you 
hear today, Roger Waters went crazy just like Syd did but not to Syd's 
extreme. Roger thought the group was his and they argued a lot for DSOTM 
and The Wall. Roger doesn't like people, hence, The Wall. The Wall was a 
little about Syd and a lot about him (Roger). Wish You Were Here was Syd.

Greatest album Unfortunately Google music player does not support gapless play mode. The 
album was designed to play gaplessly as in the phono LP. The silent gaps 
introduced by the player at the wrong spot ruin the album. Google, please 
add gapless mode option to the player.

Awesome album from one of the greatest bands! Only $0.99 for today, had to jump on it. The whiney kids who were raised 
on bubblegum pop and don't know what good music is can safely be ignored.

Another great pink Floyd album especially the 2 tracks at the end, brain 
damage/eclipse but not their best. This is looked at to be one of the best 
albums of all time and I don't think it matches up with reviews. Still 
nothing wrong with it but I'd take The Wall any day of the week over this

Any Colour You Like With the release of DSOTM, Pink Floyd hit the big time, and really began 
to mature. Dealing with themes of greed and madness, this is widely hailed 
as one of the best albums of all time. It's got something for every body.

Pink Floyd I'm over joyed They have their own unique sound. Next to The Wall album they did this is

One of the best albums ever I orginally thought this was going to be less experimental then albums 
like Atom Mother Heart and Meddle and be more cathered to radio. While it's 
not as experimental as those two albums it's easily as amazing if not 
better then them. I loved Dark Side Of The Moon from start to finish. If 
you've never heard a Pink Floyd album please do me a favor and purchase. 
And especially since it's only 99 cents for now. It'll be the best 99 cents 
ever spent.

A Masterpiece I'm usually not one to like classic rock, but this is definitely one of my

Dark side...... Fires up deep seated emotions. I'm not convinced that Dark side of the 
Moon is their most haunting work,whilst personally I think that accolade 
should possibly go to Meddle and although Clarkson often rants about a 
particular car(!)being say,Ferrari's'Dark side of the moon' car....I think 
many would argue that "The Wall"deserves the top spot..well,it's overall a 
marvel of musical elegance..with timeless appeal.

As classic as it gets Dark Side of the Moon is one of those rare albums -- alongside such works 
as Sgt Pepper, Fragile, Led Zep 4, Who's Next, Days of Future Passed, and A 
Night at the Opera -- that not only defined the phrases "classic rock" and 
"progressive rock", they shaped the rock music landscape for years (even 
decades) to come. For $.99, if you don't already own this musical landmark, 
you no longer have any reason to live in shame.

Mark Andrews One of the best bands on the planet if not THE best. This album is a 
classic and their best work in the early years and deserves a place in ANY 
music collection.

This album makes me cry I love this sound! Always I listen this album emotions take myself and I 
feel that the world is falling trought myself... I can't explain what kind 
of emotions I taste...

Best album bar none All time classic album 10 times better than anything the Beatles did, 
every track a masterpiece. Can't believe over 40 years old.

R U kidding? Quite possibly one of the top 3 rock albums of all time. It's definitely 
one of those "where were you when this came out" records. And at $.99? Duh.

Best concert too This is one of my favorite albums. I'm 34. & out of the many concerts I 
went to when I was younger, this one was my favorite! (Note:this is not a 
live albumb, I was just saying in reference to when its songs where topping 
the charts, the related concert around that time was also great!) If you 
love ANY classic rock this is a must own for your library. Its also 
relaxing, in my point of view. Ahead of its time instrumental ;-)

A modern classic! Now usually, my playlist consists of a heady mix of various rock and metal 
artists, but what I do appreciate is real music with true soul, and this 
album is no exception. Lana's voice sounds and feels like whiskey soaked 
silk and she is unashamedly brutal, whilst still managing to maintain an 
air of athearal elegance! If you've not heard this album yet, you 
absolutely should! 10 stars if I could, would recommend!!

Great album This is probably my favourite album from 2014, stand out tracks are: 1 to 
5 and The Other Woman. I thought West Coast was a weak single but in the 
context of the whole album it works well. I much prefer this one to Born to 
Die. It would have been great if they included the song from Maleficent 
here too.

lana del la Reina she is the queen, her words penetrate deeper than truth. love her music. 
old money lol sounds like she starts out singing Romeo and juliet theme 
song. old money ? as in the capulets etc? lol . good one. or maybe i just 
have a fine tuned ear either way.. shes a genius.

Unexpected I don't listen to Lana, i have only heard the Summertime Sadness Cedric 
Gervais remix. I thought that the production was great. My favorites were 
Ultraviolence, Cruel World, West Coast, Brooklyn Baby, and Shades of Cool. 
While it wasn't the conventional upbeat tempo of most of the songs I listen 
to, the album distinguishes itself from others, making it an interesting 
listening experience. Well done.

Spectacular This album brings much more to ponder on unlike her previous work. Lana 
out does herself for sure but many say that the album's songs are boring or 
dull. I think otherwise, the story each song tells ultimately weaves 
together with all of her other song's stories to recreate the painting that 
is Lizzy Grant's life from her rise to fame to even jer downfalls. Overall, 
the album delivers in every way possible, highly recommend to anyone who 
wants to sit and think or just sing along.

MYSTIC I could listen to this on repeat forever. Although, it did have some 
worrying domestic violence glorifying lyrics - "...he hit me and it felt 
like a kiss..." I think her voice is amazing and she's maturing as an 
artist. That said, I illegally downloaded the entire thing.

Sorry I will try to forget this album even exists because I love her so much. 
But I couldn't find even one song on this album that I liked enough to play 
all the way through. Too slow and depressing in a pitiful way, not a 
romanticized depression like her old songs.

Lana is The queen She is like a goddess with an angel given voice. I want that album so bad! 
❤❤❤❤ As i said Nobody can get better than Lana and her incredible powerful 
glorious songs!

I thought she was overrated until I heard this album Now I completely regret saying I ever though that about her. The first 
song I heard off this album was "Brooklyn Baby" and I felt something I had 
not felt in a VERY long time from any music I've heard. You can hear so 
much emotion in her voice...it is just so beautiful and haunting at the 
same time. Lana is the artist of this generation, she has elegance and 
style that goes way and beyond any current artists. There's no match to 
this lady ♡

The Goddess delivers!!!! I have been listening to Lana since Born To Die, and this by far is her 
best album! Once I heard the leak of Black Beauty way back when and West 
Coast when she was at Coachella, I knew this album would be a hit. Anyways 
this album truly deserves 5 stars because this is what she is meant to 
sing. If you are on the fence about getting this album, with all due 
respect, you aren't a true Lana fan.

Love. Authentic and raw, she sings for other people, she sings their stories and 
passions. In this album she dropped the urbanish beats (used in BTD) and 
changed styles as it becomes more soft rockish. Absolutely love her and her 
music.

Strange but awesome !! This Woman never ceases to amaze me with her sultry, raw, awe inspiring 
musical talent and passion for life. A great "relaxing" effect whenever I 
listen to her music. Peculiarly mesmerising & relieves the frustrations and 
stress of the rush hour drive.

Loving the Ultraviolence era Well done to Lana, the only original artist out there! She has blown me 
away! Ignore the critics. She deserves every grammy/award

Listened for hours with my girl. We played one of her albums woke Chillin' and grillin' on the deck. Good 
times!

Lana slays once again The album is amazing, each and every song is amazingly strong too. I loved 
Born To Die, but Ultraviolence is even better

Lana does it again Lana includes a song for every mood and emotion, her voice is perfect. My 
faves are Old Money and Shades of Cool. Not ashamed to say I cried 
throughout several songs. My fave artist of all time.

Lana del Ray Lana del Ray takes you on a sonic ride through a complicated tapestry of 
love, sex, exploitation, envy and violence. Her voice drips over the 
swirling production of Black Keys master guitarist Dan Aurbach. All this 
while being made in Nashville during Mr Aurbach's divorce. Lana ' s lush 
voice is the perfect backdrop for her tales of unalarmed pathos. She is the 
female Nero crooning while her world burns down. Her and Aurbach elevate 
this effort to an immensely more sophisticated place than Born to Di

Slaying Once Again Lana makes another great album that is filled with brilliant songs. My 
personal favorites are West Coast, Ultraviolence, and Brooklyn Baby. This 
is a fantastic album, I highly recommend!

Love lana but not Google music I bought an album here one time just to find out that I can't download it 
to my computer. You basically own the album to be able to stream it with 
Google music. Ridiculous

Sadcore prom One of the things I really dig about Lana Del Rey besides her being an 
extremely sexy and pouty type chick, is that she re-creates this fifties 
sixties type vibe with her music, mixing into the new millennia sound and 
makes it her own. She's not breaking any new ground but she's definitely 
making it fresh and sexy. And her lyrics are very clever dark funny and 
weird. Keep doing your thing woman your doing it good!

LANA DEL SLAY HAS DONE IT AGAIN! The album is great, every song is brilliant, and is definitely worth the 
purchase. My favourite songs on the album are Florida Kilos, Brooklyn Baby 
and Cruel World.

Ultraviolence LP Ultraviolence is an outstanding, melancholy, and beautiful 2nd record with 
haunting songs like 'cruel world' 'pretty when you cry' and 
'ultraviolence'. Although if you really want good sound, then support your 
local record shop by purchasing the vinyl. Vinyl is always better than 
download ✌
